title: Manakete Princess
opening: The Sable Order fought valiantly to keep Marth’s army from reaching Chiasmir, but in the end Grust’s knights buckled: the world’s mightiest only in song. The League marched on to the Fane of Raman, a holy sanctuary built by the divine dragoons to house their most priceless treasures. Here another story was set to begin...

intro.speaker: Gharnef
intro.line: Tiki... Tiki... Princess-that-was of the great divine dragons ...Can you hear my voice?

intro.speaker: Gharnef
intro.line: Defilers have set foot inside the fane- despoilers! Punish them. Let your fire consume them!

intro.speaker: Tiki
intro.line: Defilers... in the fane... Punish them...

intro.speaker: Gharnef
intro.line: Remember, Tiki. Your divine dragon kin perished long ago, and Bantu has abandoned you... I alone am protecting you from Medeus. Remember...

intro.speaker: Tiki
intro.line: You alone... are protecting me... Punish... the defilers...

recruit-talk.speaker: Bantu
recruit-talk.line: Tiki! Tiki, my child! At last, I have found you!

recruit-talk.speaker: Bantu
recruit-talk.line: Hm? ...Gharnef has put you in some sort of trance, poor thing. Peace, child. Peace. Awaken.

recruit-talk.speaker: Tiki
recruit-talk.line: ...Mmm? ....Ban-Ban? Is that you? Where am I? What happened?

recruit-talk.speaker: Bantu
recruit-talk.line: Yes, child. ’tis I, ’tis I. How I worried! Are you hurt?

recruit-talk.speaker: Tiki
recruit-talk.line: No, Ban-Ban, just...just scared...I feel as though I just woke from an awful nightmare...

recruit-talk.speaker: Bantu
recruit-talk.line: I am truly sorry, child. Truly, I am. I will not let us be separated again. From now on, I will be there to protect you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Tiki
recruit-talk.line: Promise? You have to promise, Ban-Ban. I hate being alone...

recruit-battle.speaker: Tiki
recruit-battle.line: Ban-Ban... Wh-why did you leave me?

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: You must be Tiki. Bantu told me all about you.

battle-talk.speaker: Tiki
battle-talk.line: Ban-Ban told me all about you, too. Will you take me with you?

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: Of course, Tiki, as long as that’s what you want.

battle-talk.speaker: Tiki
battle-talk.line: Yes, yes, it is! Oh, thank you, Mar-Mar!

battle-talk.speaker: Tiki
battle-talk.line: Am I not allowed to call you that?

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: N- That is- Er- Well, if you want.

battle-talk.speaker: Tiki
battle-talk.line: Xaney?! Why are you imitating me!

battle-talk.speaker: Xane
battle-talk.line: Xaney?! Why are you imitating me!

battle-talk.speaker: Xane
battle-talk.line: Huh? Hey, wait, Tiki! Oh come on. I was just jokin' around! Tryin' to lighten the mood! It's not like I can transform into a dragon like you so just– Oh, would you come back?

battle-talk.speaker: Xane
battle-talk.line: So how are you holdin' up, kiddo?

battle-talk.speaker: Xane
battle-talk.line: I bet they are. (...Ugh, what does Lord Gotoh expect me to do?)

battle-talk.speaker: Xane
battle-talk.line: Oh! No, no, it's nothin'. Hey, you know that Marth's countin' on those powers of yours.

battle-talk.speaker: Xane
battle-talk.line: So, uh... you just take care of yourself, that's all. You're one special kid.

end.speaker: Nyna
end.line: Marth! Tell me, was it a success? Did you locate the Lightsphere and Starsphere?

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Never fear; I have them. We need to take these to Gotoh so he can undo Imhullu’s magic... But first, Nyna, we’ve a more pressing task ahead of us.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: We must defeat Grust once and for all. If we march south without finishing them off, we have our rear exposed.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Yes. And this time, General Camus will be there to meet us. I am sure of it. Camus the Sable, they call him. Many extol him as the most able warrior alive. It will be a fierce battle... but one we cannot avoid.

end.speaker: Nyna
end.line: You are certain we must face him?

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: We have crippled Grust, but they will regroup and stand in our way again. No, we need to stamp this fire out before the wind catches it and starts spreading it anew.

end.speaker: Nyna
end.line: Very well. But before you attack, there is something I must tell you. Later, though... Not yet. I must sort my feelings out first...
